intro: Schmaltzia trilobata var. quinata, commonly known as the Quinata Schmaltzia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus, and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, adding ornamental value to its habitat. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
